title: 110_s1368
content: The Act may be cited as the "Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007" and outlines the authorities and duties of the Denali Commission. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to limit the Federal employee status of Commission members, allow acceptance of matching funds for projects, and address personnel matters within the Commission. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to restrict Federal employee status of Commission members and address personnel matters within the Commission. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to restrict Federal employee status of Commission members and address personnel matters within the Commission. This includes allowing members to waive compensation and appointing necessary personnel for Commission duties. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to enable the Commission to perform its duties and terminate appointed personnel. Additionally, the Economic Development Committee section is revised to allow for flexibility in decision-making. The Denali Commission is granted special functions under Section 3. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize a training program for careers in infrastructure development in rural Alaska. The program focuses on construction, operations, maintenance, and management of Commission projects, as well as initiatives to encourage Alaskan youths to pursue careers supporting these projects. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 authorizes a training program for infrastructure development in rural Alaska, including management training, initiatives for Alaskan youths, and assistance for teacher housing. Amounts made available to the Commission remain available until expended. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 authorizes assistance for teacher housing in rural Alaska, including housing development activities such as acquisition, rehabilitation, and new construction of housing, as well as multisite rehabilitation. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 authorizes assistance for teacher housing in rural Alaska, including housing development activities such as acquisition, rehabilitation, and new construction of housing. Section 310(a) is amended to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2009 through 2014. The effective date for the amendments is specified in sections 2, 3, and 4 of the Act.
